Alternative Hypothesis: He's just a very, very hatable champion. I've never made a Yasuo-Hate post, I don't even think he's that bad and think people blow it out of proportion. But I 100% sympathize.
He is hatable, and since he counters immobile mages (which are abundant in the midlane) it's not very surprising to see Yasuo QQing.

I'm usually fine with him, and even counter-pick him.  I don't think I've ever made a Yasuo hate thread (and if I did, it was probably asking for a reduced shield value).  Even when I fairly effectively counter him though, he's just an annoying champion to fight.

He's hard to hit, needs to be hit at least twice to do any lasting damage, can easily turn around fights, and remains a significant threat (not saying he's still able to carry, but you at least need to be wary of him) no matter how far you put him behind.

He may be a balanced champion, but he is an annoying one.  I'm not asking for him to be nerfed or anything here though.  Maybe some neutral shifts though, like reducing/removing his shield and adding some more damage to his kit as compensation would be nice, but he'd need a serious look to make such a significant change without breaking him (either making him super weak or although less likely, making him op).

Where to begin....

Well for a start, you can exclude Viktor, Syndra, Veigar, Velkoz, and Ryze from that list because they all have some form of multiplier/outside scaling/different damage type (Hex-core, Ball-ult multiplier, AP stacking passive, true damage ultimate, mana scaling).

Karthus, Cass, and Anivia are all picks practiced predominantly by mains, so you'd expect them to appear strong/fine on the surface, were the playrate to increase it'd end up looking more like Talon currently does.

Zyra and Brand i'll be honest confuse me because i'm not sure if they're strong bot, or weak mid, either way they are steadily becoming part of the support pool. 

This Leaves Orianna, Annie, Ahri, and Leblanc.
Annie is gimmicky, always has, always will.
Ahri has been likely too strong for a while now but Riot seems to not care..? (So i concede this one)
Orianna is, dare i say, also a bit too strong? Regardless, quick simple number changes would fix (another one conceded)
And lastly, LeBlanc. I'll be honest I haven't seen her all too much, personally i think shes fine, but you seem to have a reason to put her on your list, so we can leave her on the fence.

Which means your choice of champions that could be seen as accurate generalisations of mid-mages across the board really only has 2 that carry any solid weight, which I've also agreed with, and in fact think they need nerfing. The rest either are inaccurate because they have either unique forms of damage multiplication/addition and/or typing that most mages dont, are low-play rate champions that are played by mains, or don't really go mid anymore. Or is Annie.

They are simply trying to stat-check their opponents, and it costs them. Assassins have gone from "play faster" to "play smarter".
